item.title: Report E-2025020356
item.description:
Report E-2025020356

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-26T06:20:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-25
  • City: ELLENWOOD
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On February 25, 2025, three (3) 5-gallon pails of paint were damaged and released approximately ten (10) gallons of paint to the trailer interior and dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the site. The crew utilized absorbents, cleaning agents, and hand tools to remediate the surfaces. All impacted materials were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum and the damaged pails were placed in one (1) additional 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025020357
item.description:
Report E-2025020357

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-26T06:20:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-25
  • City: LEBANON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On February 25,2025, one (1) 5-gallon pail of paint was crushed and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to clean the trailer interior. All impacted materials and the damaged pail were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon and one (1) 30-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025020317
item.description:
Report E-2025020317

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-26T06:20:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-24
  • City: LORDSTOWN
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0824 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal XAY. It was reported that approximately 2 cups of Unisol Liquid Red BK-50 released from tote due to shipper not properly securing cap. The release impacted trailer #3115335. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are not capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. (Safety Googles) Per the SCM Noah Kelley terminal personnel will perform the cleanup, The terminal used a 10-gallon metal drum to containerize the waste.

  • Description: On February 21, 2025, one (1) 55-gallon drum of printing ink had defective packaging and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer interior. All waste was containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum and the damaged drum of product was overpacked in one (1) 95-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025020273
item.description:
Report E-2025020273

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-26T06:20:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-20
  • City: SULPHUR SPRINGS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: LANDSTAR INWAY, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On February 20, 2025, at 1817 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar Inway personnel in Sulphur Springs, TX regarding the release of Dynasylan® SILBOND® 40. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release of 35.0 gallons of Dynasylan® SILBOND® 40 (UN1993, 3, III) from (1) 55-gallon metal drum onto the trailer floor and asphalt. The release was reportedly due to a load shift, impacting (4) wooden pallets on the trailer floor and a 3’ x 3’ area of asphalt. No drains or waterways were impacted by the release. Contractors found that the release was evaporated by the time they arrived on site. With the proper PPE, contractors removed the (1) leaking drum and placed it into an overpack, then removed (5) damaged drums from the pallets to be reviewed by the client for disposition. Impacted pallets and plastic were broken up and containerized. All waste generated from addressing this release was containerized in (3) 55-gallon DFs and (1) 85-gallon poly overpack which were taken onsite by contractors for proper disposal.

item.title: Report X-2025021105
item.description:
Report X-2025021105

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-26T06:20:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-19
  • City: ADDISON
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AUDITOR NOTICED FLAMMABLE LIQUID HAZMAT LEAKING IN A LINE FORM FROM TOP CORNER TO BOTTOM CORNER. AUDITOR NOTIFIED SUPERVISOR AND SUPERVISOR NOTIFED RMP TO SEND A RESPONDER TO THE AUDITOR FLOOR AREA. RESPONDER ARRIVED WITH PPE ON, STOCKED SPILL CART, AND CURRENT DECISION TREE. RESPONDER READ AND FOLLOWED CURRENT DECISION TREE, WHICH LED THEM TO THE FLAMMABLE LIQUID RESPONSE SHEET SINCE HAZMAT HAD A FLAMMABLE LIQUID LABEL ON IT. RESPONDER READ FLAMMABLE LIQUID RESPONSE SHEET AND USED ZEP ZORBENT TO CONTAINERIZE THE FLAMMABLE LQUID HAZMAT INTO A SPILL TUB. RESPONDER CLEANED UP REMAINS OF ZEP ZROBENT AND HEADED BACK TO THE PSC CAGE. RESPONDER STARTED PROCESSING AFTER ARRIVING TO THE PSC CAGE.

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-26T06:20:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-18
  • City: ADDISON
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER ARRIVED AT BAY 371 WITH FULL PPE ON, STOCKED SPILL CART AND CURRENT DECISION TREE. RESPONDER READ AND FOLLOWED CURRENT DECISION TREE, WHICH LED THEM TO THE FLAMMABLE LIQUID RESPONSE SHEET BASED ON THE FLAMMABLE LIQUID LABEL ON THE PACKAGE. RESPONDER READ CURRENT FLAMMABLE LIQUID RESPONSE SHEET AND USED ZEP ZORBENT TO CONTAIN THE FLAMMABLE LIQUID HAZMAT INTO A SPILL TUB. RESPONDER USED ZEP ZORBENT ON REMAINING SPILL RESIDUE ON THE GRATING AND THE FLOOR. RESPONDER THEN RETURNED TO THE PSC CAGE WITH THE FLAMMABLE LIQUID HAZMAT PACKAGE CONTAINED IN A SPILL TUB. RESPONDER THEN STARTED PROCESSING.

item.title: Report E-2025020306
item.description:
Report E-2025020306

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-07
  • City: NORTH RIDGEVILLE
  • State: OH

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately ten (10) gallons of material released from an unknow number of 5-gallon metal pails due to improperly loaded freight that resulted in the pails leaking. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025020326
item.description:
Report E-2025020326

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-26T06:20:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-06
  • City: FREMONT
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On February 6, 2025, an incident occurred during a routine loading operation by a Veolia employee. While transferring containers onto a truck, the worker utilized a drum dolly to transport a 55-gallon polyethylene drum. Upon setting the drum down inside the vehicle, the employee observed approximately one pint of clear liquid pooling around the drum's base. Further inspection revealed a small hole at the bottom of the drum, which was the source of the leak. To contain and manage the spill, the worker promptly employed vermiculite and absorbent pads. These materials effectively prevented the liquid from spreading and facilitated the cleanup process. To ensure safe transportation to the intended facility, the compromised drum was placed inside an overpack container. This additional precaution allowed for the secure continuation of the drum's journey to its final destination.

  • Description: @ totes/IBCs, as described, loaded aboard van type trailer from pickup at Alnylam (Cambridge, MA) and enroute to Elizabeth, NJ. During loading stop at Alnylam (Norton, MA) driver conducted periodic check of load and discovered small liquid release on top of IBCs. Note, spillage remained on top of IBCs due to small qty of liquid leaked and product was cleaned up by our in-hours staff. New gaskets were used to replace existing gaskets that were on tank. Closures then tightened down to precise torque specifications from package manufacturer. Load continued to it's ultimate destination.

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 08:08 ET, XPO notified the Call Center of a cargo release at terminal XVL. It was reported that approximately 2 ounces of Total Solutions Vanquish released from one box containing four 1-gallon poly jugs due to improper loading by previous terminal. The release impacted only the carboard box container of the four 1-gallon jugs, the spill occurred on trailer #3212702 and was discovered on Dock #08 after being unloaded. Service Center Manager Michael Martucci gave permission for terminal personnel to clean up the spill. Waste label 226598-1 was created, one 5-gallon poly drum containing the carboard box containing four 1-gallon poly jugs. INFOTRAC was notified report #382116 was provided by Bobby.

item.title: Report E-2025020005
item.description:
Report E-2025020005

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-26T06:20:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-29
  • City: Waycross
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 1/29/25, at 11:31 hours, personnel in the CSXT Rice Yard in Waycross, Georgia, discovered UTLX 663268, a residue tank car which last contained Environmentally Hazardous Substances, Liquid, NOS, leaking from bottom of the tank car. The car was isolated and the shipper, Shell Chemical, was notified via CHEMTREC (Report #2025012900116). Hulls Environmental, a CSXT emergency response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found product leaking from the bottom outlet valve of the tank car. Contractor personnel identified that the bottom outlet valve was in the open position and bottom outlet valve’s secondary closure cap was less than tool tight. Response personnel closed the valve and properly secured the secondary closure cap. The issue identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper’s representative (Jeffery Bowes).

item.title: Report E-2025020004
item.description:
Report E-2025020004

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-26T06:20:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-26
  • City: Tampa
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 1/26/25, at 16:58 hours, personnel in the CSXT McCloskey Yard, in Tampa, Florida, discovered PVCX 13298, a loaded tank car of Sulfuric Acid leaking from top of tank car. The car was isolated and the shipper, Nyrstar Corporation, was notified via CHEMTREC (Report 2025-0126-00018). Hulls Environmental, a CSXT emergency response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found product leaking from top of the tank car. Contractor personnel found that the liquid line primary closure cap to be less than tool tight; and that the closure cap gasket was deteriorated. Response personnel applied a 2” pipe cap to the NPT threaded unloading adapter portion of the liquid line closure assembly to stop the release. The issue identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper’s representative (Bradley Turner). The car was held at location pending further repair by a certified tank car repair shop or One Time Movement Approval.

  • City: BATON ROUGE

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The package was found in unload by another QA member. The package was wet from the top and initially thought that the package was damaged from another damaged package. Closer inspection you can see that the battery leaked inside the package and the inner packing state it was Lead Acid Battery that is considered hazardous. The package had no hazmat markings around the package and was highly careless of the shipper. It's understandable though because the package looked like it was ordered off of Ebay (potentially) because of the shipper info.

  • Description: On February 20, 2025, one (1) 55-gallon drum of hexanes was damaged and released approximately 25-gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from AOTC to remediate the site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to collect all waste in one (1) 55-hallon drum. The damaged drum of product was overpacked in one (1) 95-gallon drum.

item.description:
Report E-2025020264

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-25T00:50:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-20
  • City: WOODLAND
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-XLF contacted ERTS regarding a leaking 05-PAIL containing hazardous material, Pro Form Lacquer Thinner. A contractor dispatched and observed an estimated 2-gallon release onto the wooden trailer floor in a 2’x2’ area as a result of improper blocking and bracing. The contractor identified one leaking 05-PAIL and restacked the rest of the PAILS to ship on to the Consignee. One 30-gallon DF of waste was generated containing the damaged, leaking 05-PAIL of product. XPO will manage all waste created from the response. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were involved in this incident.

  • Description: TILX 252173 (residue car) was found to be venting odor in the BNSF Barstow, CA yard. A BNSF responder assessed the car and found that the swing bolts were greater than hand-tight, but less than tool-tight. After opening the manway lid, there was no manway gasket present. The responder installed a new gasket and tool-tightened the swing bolts.

  • Description: A fiberboard box with an odor was presented to the OAKH spill office. While investigating the shipment the spill agent observed that one of the four cans was damaged on the bottom chime causing a small release. The cans all had positive closure rings, a fiberboard divider and absorbent material as dunnage. The shipment was placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

  • Description: On Feb 12th, a pallet was discovered during the AM sort that contained boxes of aerosols that had dangerous goods markings on them but were covered up by black shrink wrap. The markings were discovered due to the shrinkwrap being torn and the mark visible. Upon further investigation the boxes contained UN1950 Aerosols, 2.2. There were no markings on the outside of the shrinkwrap indicating any DG. The pallet is being held pending FAA investigation.

  • City: ELLENWOOD

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-BAT contacted ERTS regarding a punctured lead acid battery. A contractor dispatched and observed an estimated 150-gallon of battery acid released onto the wooden trailer floor in a 40’x8.5’ area, The concrete dock floor in a 6’x10’ area, and the concrete beneath the trailer in a 60’x 20’ area resulting from a forklift puncture. The contractor neutralized the release using citric acid and applied oil dry. Four 55-gallon DF’s of waste were generated containing the neutralized impacted oil dry. PPE, poly sheeting, absorbent pads and pallet pieces. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were involved in this incident.

item.title: Report X-2025020828
item.description:
Report X-2025020828

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-25T00:50:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-23
  • City: GARY
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: Illinois Central Railroad Company
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 22000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A CN Mechanical employee observed liquid coming from the top of tank car GATX 818584 while performing an outbound inspection at the CN Kirk yard in Gary, In. The employee notified the employee in charge who then notified the CN Dangerous Goods Team and CN Environment to investigate. A CN Dangerous Goods Officer performed an inspection of the tank car noting the shipper applied protective housing security seal to be intact. The seal was removed for inspection. The inspection revealed liquid pooling around the base of the 2" liquid line valve. The valve was found to be less than tool tight at the connection to the fittings plate and could be turned easily by hand allowing product to leak out during transportation. The 2" liquid valve was tightened with an 18" pipe wrench stopping the leak. The tank car was then cleaned by a CN Dangerous Goods Team contractor. The tank car remains in hold at Kirk yard until the shipper repairs and re-qualifies the car or an OTMA-1 is received for continued movement to destination or home shop.

  • Description: At 0428 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal NLK. It was reported that approximately 1 gallon of Tamco HR-1370 Urethane Reducer was released from a 2.5-gallon metal pail due to improper packaging by the shipper. The release impacted trailer #3152158 and has almost dried up. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller, and they felt comfortable cleaning up the release with PPE available on-site. Called Infotrac and spoke to Bud. Report #381451. The metal pail was containerized into (1) 10-gallon metal drum.

item.title: Report E-2025010289
item.description:
Report E-2025010289

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-25T00:50:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-21
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: ME
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 1500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: One 01/21/2025, at approximately 21:14 hours, personnel in the CSX Rigby Yard in Portland, Maine, discovered tank car TEIX 33556 , load of Liquefied Petroleum Gas, was leaking from the top of the car. The car was isolated and the shipper, AUX Sable Liquid Products, was notified via CHEMTREC (Report 2025-01-21-00171). Additionally, the South Portland Fire Department and Maine Department of the Environmental Protection were notified. Fire department personnel responded and found the cause of the release was the tank car’s sample line valve was partially open and the secondary securement plug was less than tool tight. Fire department personnel closed the valve to stop the release. HEPACO, a CSX emergency response contractor, was also dispatched to the incident to conduct a secondary inspection and ensure the car was properly secured for transportation. The issue was identified, and corrective actions, were communicated to the shipper’s representative- Brad Brancato (brad.brancato@auxsable.com).

item.title: Report E-2025020265
item.description:

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-21
  • City: ABILENE
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0134 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at LAB. It was reported that approximately 55 gallons of Duroct Zirconium 18 % released from a 55-gallon DM due to a forklift puncture by terminal LAB. The release impacted inside trailer # 3193748 and under the trailer at dock door 3. Oil dri has been used for containment. Health & Safety Filter Mask for gases and vapors is required. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 55-gallons of UN1993 Duroct Zirconium product released to a 48’x8.5 area of the trailer floor and concrete due to a forklift puncture. Contractors applied absorbents to solidity the liquid and containerized (3) 55-gallon poly drums with spent absorbent and debris and overpacked the 55-gallon metal drum in (1) 95-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On February 19, 2025, eight (8) 5-gallon pails of paint were crushed and released approximately two (2) gallons to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services who dispatched a crew from LoneStar Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the site. LSH removed all damaged product and placed them into one (1) 85-gallon overpack . LSH personnel deployed granular absorbents to the paint-impacted trailer and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum.

A contractor dispatched and observed an estimated 1-cup of product released onto the wooden trailer floor and concrete dock floor in a 12’ x 8.5’ area as a result of improper packaging (exterior corrosion). The contractor overpacked the damaged, leaking drum into one 95-gallon DF for waste disposal. Soda ash was applied to the release and the impacted pallet and both were containerized into one 55-gallon DF for waste disposal. XPO will manage all waste created from the response. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were involved in this incident.

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-17
  • City: W SACRAMENTO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On February 17, 2025, one (1) 275-gallon tote of UN3264 was damaged and released approximately twelve (12) ounces of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services. LC who dispatched a crew from Graymar Environmental Services (GES) to remediate the trailer interior. GES personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted trailer floor and swept them in with hand tools. GES personnel transferred the product from the damaged 275-gallon tote to a new 275-gallon tote for further shipment by the terminal. One (1) 55-gallon drum containing all spent absorbents, PPE, and cleanup debris, and one (1) 55-gallon drum containing the broken-down damaged 275-gallon tote were staged onsite as waste.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Felix Toribio, Operations Supervisor, called safety to report a spill in trailer 84287. The spill involved UN1219, ISOPROPYL ALCOHOL, Class 3, PG II. Felix stated that a pallet containing a box with four 1-gallon pails appeared to have been struck by other freight or the tip of forklift forks while loading the trailer. The pallet looks to have been damaged as well. The pallet is wrapped in wrap and is positioned right at the doors of the trailer, with approximately 8 oz spilled from one of the 1-gallon pails onto the trailer floor. Safety advised that CURA would be called to assist with the c leanup of the spill in the trailer and the pallet.

  • Description: RESPONDED TO AN AIR PACKAGE DUE TO THE RATTLE OF AEROSOL CANS. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED TWO INNER BOXES MARKED AS GROUND LIMITED QUANTITY. ONE BOX CONTAINS TWELVE FLAMMABLE AEROSOL CANS OF GEAR SHIELD EXTRA HEAVY EXTREME PRESSURE LUBRICANT, EACH AT 11OZ. THE OTHER LIMITED QUANTITY MARKED INNER BOX CONTAINS TWELVE FLAMMABLE AEROSOL CANS OF SPRAYON DRY FILM MOLY LUBRICANT, EACH AT 11OZ. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED USING SHIPPER NUMBER 447057, PENNSYLVANIA BEARING, 1951 N GRIFFITH BLVD, GRIFFITH IN 46319-1043. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

  • Description: Passenger had vaping pen on their person and felt it getting hot. Passenger gave it to the flight attendant and there the battery went into thermal runaway and fire was seen coming from the device. Fire was extinguished and device was cooled. Device was then placed in the onboard fire containment bag and more water added. Device was monitored until landing in MDW and then it was given to local SWA Ground Ops personnel. Passenger was not using the device at the time it started getting hot., After landing, passenger deplaned and never spoke with SWA so we could get their information.

TCB gloves were used to retrieve the device, and it was successfully contained, The device was placed in a Iavatory by 4R for the remainder of the flight Chemical odor Iingered in the cabin long after the event.

  • Description: PVS driver hooked up truck for offload at customer site. 6-7 minutes into offload, the flange that the hose hooks up t0 came off with pressure spraying ferrous chloride out the back of the tanker. The driver shut the tanker down. Driver proceeded to clean up the entire area and his tracto^/truck, washing it down into containment. He notified the personnel on site, and they verbally confirmed that it was cleaned it up. Total loss of containment 50 gallons. Spill determined to be caused by break in pipe. Break was due to stress caused by temperature difference between product and truck, lack of bracing, and possibly the improper sequence of pressurizing the truck and hose.

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: I Responded to a single vehicle rollover involving a CMV hauling HAZMAT. The CMV left the roadway, overcorrected, and rolled onto the passenger side. See C10-25-00003 for further details. The jarring from exiting/reentering the roadway, and rolling onto its side, caused the product being shipping to rupture/leak from the trailer. Several Fire Departments responded to the scene, along with MABAS HAZMAT Crew, to contain the spill. Initially, a 100 meter exclusionary zone was established for safety. The crews placed yellow boom in and around the trailer to contain the spill. E-Environmental Solutions was contacted to mitigate the spill. Until deemed safe the estimated duration of release was 2 hours. IBCs appeared to have leaked out of the filler cap due to the overturn- no overt damage observable. Load is intermittently reacting with the atmosphere(emitting gas vapors)- unable to ascertain Ieakage from IBC's in nose of trailer. The lane closure will continue until mitigation completed

  • Description: Hepaco arrived onsite and observed an area measuring approximately 200ft-by-25ft impacted by released diesel fuel and Nyquil due to a fatal multi-vehicle accident that closed the highway for multiple hours. Hepaco personnel deployed absorbent boom and used absorbent pads to prevent migration of the released materials and then the site was secured for remediation. Hepaco returned to the site four days later to excavate the impacted area. Five 55-gallon metal drums of soil contaminated with diesel and Nyquil were generated. The generated waste was transported offsite for disposal.
